name: ln
summary: Computes the natural logarithm of the number.

name: log
summary: Computes the logarithm of the number with respect to an arbitrary base.
description: The result might not be correctly rounded owing to implementation details; `log2()` can produce more accurate results for base 2, and `log10()` can produce more accurate results for base 10.

name: log10
summary: Computes the base 10 logarithm of the number.

name: log2
summary: Computes the base 2 logarithm of the number.

name: max
summary: Computes the maximum of the given arguments.

name: min
summary: Computes the minimum of the given arguments.

name: pi
summary: Return the value of `pi`. Archimedes constant ().

name: pow
summary: Computes the number to a power.

summary: Returns the angle of the segment.

oneOf.description: Raise a number to a power.
Raise a number to a power.
Raise a number to a power.
An inline comment. Here are examples: `1 + 1 // This is an inline comment`. `1 + 1 /* Here's another */`.

A block comment. An example of this is the following: ```python,no_run /* This is a block comment */ 1 + 1 ``` Now this is important. The block comment is attached to the next line. This is always the case. Also the block comment doesn't have a new line above it. If it did it would be a `NewLineBlockComment`.
A block comment that has a new line above it. The user explicitly added a new line above the block comment.

A block comment that has a new line above it. The user explicitly added a new line above the block comment.

name: tan
summary: Computes the tangent of a number (in radians).

name: tangentialArc
summary: Draw an arc.

schema.description: Data to draw a tangential arc.

offset.description: Offset of the arc, in degrees.

radius.description: Radius of the arc. Not to be confused with Raiders of the Lost Ark.

to.description: Where the arc should end. Must lie in the same plane as the current path pen position. Must not be colinear with current path pen position.

anyOf.description: A point where the arc should end. Must lie in the same plane as the current path pen position. Must not be colinear with current path pen position.
